line_1: AH Thou! whom Nature and thy Stars design'd,
line_2: At once the Joy and Envy of Mankind,

line_1: At once the Joy and Envy of Mankind,
line_2: AH Thou! whom Nature and thy Stars design'd,

line_1: To thy lov'd Memory this Sigh I send;
line_2: To thee a Stranger, to thy Lines a Friend:

line_1: To thee a Stranger, to thy Lines a Friend:
line_2: To thy lov'd Memory this Sigh I send;

line_1: How blest the Muse cou'd she like thine aspire,
line_2: So smooth her Accent, and sublime her Fire;

line_1: So smooth her Accent, and sublime her Fire;
line_2: How blest the Muse cou'd she like thine aspire,

line_1: With bright Description make the Bosom glow,
line_2: Charm like thy Sense, and like thy Numbers flow:

line_1: Charm like thy Sense, and like thy Numbers flow:
line_2: With bright Description make the Bosom glow,

line_1: O teach my Soul to reach the Seats divine,
line_2: And praise her Maker in a Strain like thine.

line_1: And praise her Maker in a Strain like thine.
line_2: O teach my Soul to reach the Seats divine,

line_1: Ye careless Ones, who never thought before,
line_2: Read this grand Verse, then tremble and adore:

line_1: Read this grand Verse, then tremble and adore:
line_2: Ye careless Ones, who never thought before,

line_1: Let stern Enthusiasts here be taught to know,
line_2: 'Tis from the Heart true Piety must flow:

line_1: 'Tis from the Heart true Piety must flow:
line_2: Let stern Enthusiasts here be taught to know,

line_1: Here Hope, Content, and smiling Mercy shine;
line_2: And breathe celestial through the speaking Line:

line_1: And breathe celestial through the speaking Line:
line_2: Here Hope, Content, and smiling Mercy shine;

line_1: From the still Mind its guilty Passions roll,
line_2: And dawning Grace awakes the fervent Soul.

line_1: And dawning Grace awakes the fervent Soul.
line_2: From the still Mind its guilty Passions roll,

line_1: Let angry Zealots quarrel for a Name,
line_2: The good, the just, the virtuous are the same:

line_1: The good, the just, the virtuous are the same:
line_2: Let angry Zealots quarrel for a Name,

line_1: Grace to no Sect, nor Virtue is confin'd;
line_2: They blend with all, and spread amongst the kind;

line_1: They blend with all, and spread amongst the kind;
line_2: Grace to no Sect, nor Virtue is confin'd;

line_1: And the pure Flame that warms the pious Breast:
line_2: Those cannot merit who condemn the rest.

line_1: Those cannot merit who condemn the rest.
line_2: And the pure Flame that warms the pious Breast:

line_1: To the dark Nations when Religion came,
line_2: All drest in Smiles; they saw the heav'nly Dame,

line_1: All drest in Smiles; they saw the heav'nly Dame,
line_2: To the dark Nations when Religion came,

line_1: Till some stern Teachers of their Office proud,
line_2: Chose not to soften but affright the Crowd,

line_1: Chose not to soften but affright the Crowd,
line_2: Till some stern Teachers of their Office proud,

line_1: And veil'd her Beauties in the mask of Rage:
line_2: With gloomy Terrors fill'd the dusky Age,

line_1: Then bid the Hand-maids of Perdition rise,
line_2: Black Cruelty with fierce and flaming Eyes;

line_1: Black Cruelty with fierce and flaming Eyes;
line_2: Then bid the Hand-maids of Perdition rise,

line_2: And Persecution wore the Robe of Zeal:

line_1: And Persecution wore the Robe of Zeal:
line_2: Distraction ravag'd on the publick Weal,

line_1: Deluded Faith espous'd the stronger Side,
line_2: And conquer'd Justice gave her Sword to Pride.

line_1: And conquer'd Justice gave her Sword to Pride.
line_2: Deluded Faith espous'd the stronger Side,

line_2: By Nature haughty and to Vice inclin'd:

line_1: By Nature haughty and to Vice inclin'd:
line_2: This saw the surly discontented Mind,

line_1: And thence concluded all their Systems vain,

line_2: Who scorn what Reason or the Priests impose:

line_1: Who scorn what Reason or the Priests impose:

line_2: And tear from Man his ever-conscious Soul.

line_1: And tear from Man his ever-conscious Soul.
line_2: Who give to Chance the World's that round us roll,

line_2: Whom future Ages shall like me admire)

line_1: Whom future Ages shall like me admire)
line_2: (Whose Lines can Wit and Virtue both inspire,

line_2: Keep my own Faith, yet not condemn the rest.

line_1: Our Theme is Hope — but of a diff'rent kind,
line_2: The Bane or Blessing of the subject Mind;

line_1: The Bane or Blessing of the subject Mind;
line_2: Our Theme is Hope — but of a diff'rent kind,

line_1: As a short Earnest of its future Heav'n:
line_2: This dawning Joy that to the Soul was given,

line_2: But warn our Sisters not to place it wrong.

line_1: But warn our Sisters not to place it wrong.
line_2: To blame is not the Purpose of my Song,

line_1: The constant Torment of a restless Soul:

line_1: With Store of Logick in his aking Head,

line_1: And the proud Prelate to a Curate turns
